channel.title: BuddyTV
channel.description: BuddyTV - TV News, Spoilers, Pictures, Profiles, Forums, and Live Commentary

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' Week 5 Preview: The Pros Return for Len Goodman's Side-By-Side Challenge
item.description:
Dancing with the Stars season 16 enters its fifth week, with fans having shown so far that if the stars can't dance, they won't last long. Dorothy Hamill bowed out, then American helped vote off country singer Wynonna Judd and reality star Lisa Vanderpump, as both showed they were two of the weakest dancers this season.

Will the fans continue to vote off the weakest dancers? Tonight, ABC adds to the difficulty with Len Goodman's side-by-side challenge. Can funny men D.L. Hughley and Andy Dick keep pace with the rest of the stars as the competition starts to get tougher?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: ?The Amazing Race? Week 8 Likeability Rankings: Winning Proves to Be More Likeable
item.description:
For the third week in a row, Bates and Anthony dominated the race and came in first place, but did they top the likeability rankings with best friends Pam and Winnie gone? One thing is for sure this week -- season 22 of The Amazing Race just reached a whole new level of difficulty as teams raced through the frigid conditions in Switzerland trying to transport wheels of cheese. Teams were pushed to the limits physically and mentally on ?My Cheese is Out of Control." And we found out coming in last makes you a lot less likeable.

Download the BuddyTV Guide app for your phone now to find out which teams are leading season 22 of The Amazing Race.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Good Wife' Recap: Alicia's Anonymous Friends of the Court
item.description:
All through the latest episode of The Good Wife, I had to ask myself, am I watching the evening news? Because that's how up-to-the-minute it felt.

The Good Wife is nothing if not topical. But this week, it's as though they predicted events of the past week, even though the episode was probably filmed two months ago. (Even Law & Order never managed that trick.) Plus, Cary may be leaving L&G and Diane's engaged -- those are pretty important bits of news, too.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 2013 MTV Movie Awards: Memorable Moments and Complete List of Winners
item.description:
Silver Linings Playbook was the big winner at the MTV Movie Awards, one in which the award that was given out -- Best WTF Moment -- could've applied to the skits throughout the night. We're looking at you, Seth Rogen and Danny McBride. 

I can't give an awards show rave review when Jennifer Lawrence isn't there -- and thus can't recreate her SLP kiss with co-star Bradley Cooper -- and Taylor Lautner doesn't take his shirt off. Nevertheless, here are some of the more memorable moments.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Best ?Game of Thrones? Quotes from ?Walk of Punishment?
item.description: The best quotes from the third episode of season 3 of Game of Thrones.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta' Reunion Part 2 Recap: NeNe Shows Her Claws
item.description:
Part two of this three-part reunion looks to bring out NeNe's defensive side. Part three will be the best part, with the drama and tension at its highest, but still offering a conclusion that should leave you comfortable with the end of the season. Part two, though, just leaves you hanging in the shade-throwing balance. 

NeNe has spent the entire season keeping the peace and playing it cool. But now we get to see the claws come out. It begins with discussing the evolution of her relationship with Gregg. Last season, they went through a divorce and this season they fell back in love. She talked about the trouble they had in previous years stemming from some things that the ladies had said about her. The confrontations don't stop there. Here are the top five NeNe moments from part two of the Real Housewives of Atlanta reunion.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Mad Men' Recap: Has Pete Finally Gone Too Far?
item.description: On Mad Men, to say an episode is about cheating is like saying the sky is blue. Perhaps this week's episode, in which we spend time watching both Pete and Don stray, isn't so much about cheating as it is about the repercussions of cheating. Last week, the two-hour season 6 premiere was all about death. Yet this week's installment somehow managed to feel even bleaker than that death and doom filled outing.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'All-Star Celebrity Apprentice' Recap: Not Everything's Silver and Australian Gold
item.description: Once upon a last week, the Celebrity Apprentice was only an hour. Those days are long gone and we have two hours to experience every Gary Busey outburst and every Marilu Henner memory tic. Yay?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Borgias' Season 3 Premiere Recap: Will the Borgias Survive?
item.description: The Borgias returns from quite the cliffhanger: Pope Rodrigo Borgia hovers between life and death, while the danger from the college of cardinals might just pale in comparison to the danger of the wily Caterina Sforza.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Amazing Race' Recap: Up in the Swiss Air
item.description: On this week's Amazing Race, we trade desert for snowy mountains in Switzerland for the least perfect way to transition from winter to spring.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Kardashians' Roundup: Kim May Give Birth in Paris, Jonathan Cheban Defends Kim, Plus More Court Drama
item.description: Kim Kardashian is reportedly considering to give birth to her first child with Kanye West in Paris, where her boyfriend also has a pad. A source close to the couple told TMZ that the Keeping Up with the Kardashians star has been looking into the maternity ward of a hospital in the fashion capital of the world.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Game of Thrones' Recap: The Hand of the Kingslayer
item.description: Game of Thrones is getting a little out of control in season 3 with about a thousand different locations and new characters. This week we travel to nine different places where Catelyn's dad's funeral, Theon's escape attempt, a Small Council meeting, a farewell to Hot Pie, a deal for dragons and some rather serious consequences for Jaime Lannister. There are also two different threats of rape, which isn't very pleasant.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Glee' Casts Patty Duke and Meredith Baxter, Plans Finale Proposal
item.description: Wedding bells could be in the air on Glee once again in the season 4 finale. EOnline first reported that, in the upcoming fourth season finale, one of the show's main characters will propose to the love of his life.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Defiance' Photos: Meet the Cast
item.description: Set in the near future, Defiance introduces an exotically transformed planet Earth, its landscapes permanently altered following the sudden ? and tumultuous ? arrival of seven unique alien races. In this somewhat unknown and unpredictable landscape, the richly diverse, newly-formed civilization of humans and aliens must learn to co-exist peacefully. Each week, viewers will follow an immersive character drama set in the boom-town of Defiance, which sits atop the ruins of St. Louis, MO. - From Syfy
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revenge' Season 2 Finale: Who Dies?
item.description:
It's been long known that someone would die towards the end Revenge season 2.

Executive Producer Mike Kelley has provided more insight into the death over the last few weeks. He told TV Line that "one of our core cast members will not survive the finale." He continued to tease, "It?ll be a surprise who it is ? and it?s certainly a surprise to Emily." Unlike the deaths that opened both season 1 and 2, this death will not be a cliffhanger and will be known by the end of the finale.

Kelley previously told ET , "We knew very early on what this finale was going to be, and it's going to rock Emily to her core. It will make the whole Initiative storyline resonate emotionally with everyone, so people understand what we've been laying down and why."

While it's possible that these two events are unrelated, it would make sense for them to be connected. So, who will die?

We breakdown the possibilities by their danger level based on the clues and also taking into account the person's overall importance on the show: LOW: Highly unlikely to be the victim because they don't fit the clues. MODERATE: Fit at least one of the clues, so they can't be entirely discounted. EXTREME: You should prepare yourself for their death. They fit the criteria.

Check out the reasons for and against each character being the victim.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: CBS Reveals Season Finale Storylines: Hilary Duff, Black Sabbath and NYC Mayor to Guest Star
item.description: We're only weeks away from being able to watch the season finales of our favorite TV shows. To get us to tune in, CBS has released the storylines for their spring 2013 finales, including The Good Wife, Two and a Half Men, NCIS and Elementary. And many of them are bringing in famous guest stars like Hilary Duff, Black Sabbath, Marilu Henner and New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg to spice things up and bring in more viewers. Which shows will they be guest starring on? And which season-enders are sure to leave us with huge cliffhangers? Read on to find out all the details.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: TV?s 25 Sexiest Brothers
item.description: If good looks are genetic, then these families are all doubly blessed. It?s a good rule of thumb on TV that if a guy is hot, then so is his brother, so here are the top 25 sexiest brothers on television.

item.title: 'Hannibal': 23 Creepiest Moments from 'Amuse-Bouche'
item.description: Hannibal is visibly stunning to watch and that makes it even more creepy at times. Check out the creepiest moments from "Amuse-Bouche."
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: [Video] 'Glee' Recreates 'Don't Stop Believin''
item.description:
A lot of Glee fans complain that the show has lost some of the magic it had back in season 1. Well, in the next new episode, "Sweet Dreams," Glee is going back to where it all began.

In the episode, Rachel finally auditions for Funny Girl on Broadway, and during her audition, her mind flashes back to the start of New Directions and the iconic performance that ended the pilot, Journey's "Don't Stop Believin.'"
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Should 'American Idol' Replace the Judges' Save with a Judges' Veto?
item.description: April 11 will forever be known as the day American Idol viewers, judges and contestants could breathe a sigh of relief, knowing that our national nightmare was over: Lazaro Arbos, one of the least talented singers ever to grace the Idol stage, was eliminated. But it was the day before, on April 10, that he delivered what many have called the worst performance in the history of the show.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'NCIS' Fan-Favorite Muse Watson Returning as Mike Franks for Season 10 Finale
item.description: NCIS fans have been buzzing for the last 24 hours on Twitter about the return of Mike Franks (played by Muse Watson) for the season 10 finale. But is the news of Franks' return really true? Have the prayers of many an NCIS fan been answered? The answer is: Yes!

item.title: 'Project Runway' Recap: Fashion Is Not Art
item.description:
Michelle's fate continues to linger in Project Runway limbo. At the end of last week's episode, Heidi informed designer that she had a "second chance" at staying in the competition. What on earth could that mean?!

Tonight, the competition spreads out as the final five are sent on a challenge unlike any other, gathering inspiration from international fashion capitals. Fashion Week is right around the corner. Who do you think will make the cut?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com
